title: five visits
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2uCPEvu

by writerforlife

After using the Infinity Gauntlet to restore the lives of half the universe, Tony falls into a coma. Those most important to him have a lot to say.

Words: 9065, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, Gen, M/M
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Peter Parker, Pepper Potts, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Happy Hogan
  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Steve Rogers & Tony Stark, James “Bucky” Barnes/Steve Rogers
  • Additional Tags: Angst, Angst with a Happy Ending, Hurt/Comfort, Coma, Poor Tony, I promise I’m not too mean to him though

summary: I’m not that old, people certainly weren’t still using analog computers for many things when I was growing up. I admit I’m still...
body: I’m not that old, people certainly weren’t still using analog computers for many things when I was growing up. I admit I’m still partial to the Commodore 64 though, that was the first computer I got all to myself back in the early 80′s. Probably got that thing in a box somewhere, should go look for it.

reblog.comment: I’m not that old, people certainly weren’t still using analog computers for many things when I was growing up. I admit I’m still partial to the Commodore 64 though, that was the first computer I got all to myself back in the early 80′s. Probably got that thing in a box somewhere, should go look for it.

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

summary: Yall notice how Tony had such a dad voice to Peter Quill?
title: Yall notice how Tony had such a dad voice to Peter Quill?
body:
*Drax and Peter Q. sneaking out to the dance*
Tony: ummm where are you two going?
Drax: Tell him about the dance off to save the galaxy!
Tony: *crosses arms* What dance off?
Peter Q: i-it's not a dance off...

dialogue.phrase: *Drax and Peter Q. sneaking out to the dance*

blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: Waterloo
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2zLAKso

by Sholio

Nebula decides to try out this whole “friendship” and “doing people favors” thing … specifically, killing Tony’s parents’ killer for him. For my h/c bingo “brainwashing/deprogramming” square. (There is no actual character death in this, but definitely Infinity War spoilers.)

Words: 2934, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply

summary: Have you watched my latest parody video? It’s a “The Good Place”/“Infinity war” mashup! Tony stark arrives at the good place and...
caption:
Have you watched my latest parody video? It’s a “The Good Place”/“Infinity war” mashup! Tony stark arrives at the good place and has some thoughts.

The video was sponsored by the lovely online streaming service for everything horror and supernatural: Shudder. Click the link below and enter the promo code ONLYLEIGH for a FREE 30 DAY TRIAL! https://goo.gl/h1Fe1N 

I would never be sponsored by anything i don’t believe in which is why i do it so rarely, but shudder is legit, and run by truly passionate people. Have fun!

tags: i don't even know what happeed here i just wanted peter to find out tony didn't like the dark
summary: Peter Parker being utterly terrified of small spaces after what happened in Homecoming, but he never says it to any of the...
body:
Peter Parker being utterly terrified of small spaces after what happened in Homecoming, but he never says it to any of the Avengers because he can’t have weaknesses, he can’t be afraid of anything, none of them are- they’re only going to be reminded of how childish he is if he admits something like that. 

Except one night they’re all eating take-out in the compound, and for the life of him Peter can’t remember how they managed to get onto the topic, but they start talking about fears. At first, Peter just shakes his head, denies it, he’s Spiderman, he’s not afraid of anything- but then he hears Steve speak, really quietly, and admit that he can’t stand being in water. Not after the plane crash. 

And then Thor speaks up. He tells them all that he’s absolutely terrified of being alone. He can’t stand it, and sometimes it takes as little as a day of solitude before he has to find someone, anyone to talk to, or he feels like he can’t breathe.

Then Natasha tells everyone she’s afraid of dogs, her face blank, her fists slightly clenched, and she doesn’t explain any further, and no one asks. Clint tells them all he has a horrible fear of needles. Every time he needs an injection, he vomits. Bruce? Bruce has panic attacks in large crowds. He tells them all he has to skip out on charity galas and parties because he’s so terrified, sometimes.

Then Peter looks at Tony, and expects nothing, because really, it’s Iron Man. He’s been through everything, and he doesn’t even bat an eye at any of it. He’s the one Peter could never have finding out about his own weakness. Because Tony trusts him, Tony respects him, and if he knew Peter was so afraid of something so trivial, he’d surely-

“I’m scared of the dark,” Tony shrugs, looking down, and Peter just… stops.

The dark. Something as simple as the dark, and Tony is… Tony is afraid of the dark. 

Iron Man is afraid of the dark.

Tony raises an eyebrow at Peter, and he realizes he’s staring. He looks down quickly, feeling like his heart is about to beat out of his ribcage. 

That’s the day that he discovers something very, very important.

He can be scared, and still be a hero.

That’s the day that he discovers something very, very important.

He can be scared, and still be a hero.
trail.content:
Peter Parker being utterly terrified of small spaces after what happened in Homecoming, but he never says it to any of the Avengers because he can’t have weaknesses, he can’t be afraid of anything, none of them are- they’re only going to be reminded of how childish he is if he admits something like that. 

Except one night they’re all eating take-out in the compound, and for the life of him Peter can’t remember how they managed to get onto the topic, but they start talking about fears. At first, Peter just shakes his head, denies it, he’s Spiderman, he’s not afraid of anything- but then he hears Steve speak, really quietly, and admit that he can’t stand being in water. Not after the plane crash. 

And then Thor speaks up. He tells them all that he’s absolutely terrified of being alone. He can’t stand it, and sometimes it takes as little as a day of solitude before he has to find someone, anyone to talk to, or he feels like he can’t breathe.

Then Natasha tells everyone she’s afraid of dogs, her face blank, her fists slightly clenched, and she doesn’t explain any further, and no one asks. Clint tells them all he has a horrible fear of needles. Every time he needs an injection, he vomits. Bruce? Bruce has panic attacks in large crowds. He tells them all he has to skip out on charity galas and parties because he’s so terrified, sometimes.

Then Peter looks at Tony, and expects nothing, because really, it’s Iron Man. He’s been through everything, and he doesn’t even bat an eye at any of it. He’s the one Peter could never have finding out about his own weakness. Because Tony trusts him, Tony respects him, and if he knew Peter was so afraid of something so trivial, he’d surely-

“I’m scared of the dark,” Tony shrugs, looking down, and Peter just… stops.

The dark. Something as simple as the dark, and Tony is… Tony is afraid of the dark. 

Iron Man is afraid of the dark.

Tony raises an eyebrow at Peter, and he realizes he’s staring. He looks down quickly, feeling like his heart is about to beat out of his ribcage. 

That’s the day that he discovers something very, very important.

He can be scared, and still be a hero.

blog.name: willwritefortea
blog.title: I just like writing.
blog.description:
Mostly Star Wars, Game of Thrones, The Musketeers and impure thoughts about Adam Driver. 
Now with added Infinity War.

title: The Avengers vs The Revengers
body:
Tony: So, team I wanted to discuss…what the hell is he doing here?

Loki: You can trust me, Tony. I’m part of the team.

Tony: No you’re not.

Loki: Of course I am. Just ask Thor.

Natasha: Thor, did you tell Loki he could be part of the Avengers?

Thor: No. No! Absolutely not.

Loki: Not the Avengers, the Revengers.

Steve: The what?

Bruce: Um, it was this team we made up on Sakaar….

Tony: The Revengers? Seriously? 

Natasha: What kind of crappy name is that?

Loki: Well it’s basically the same name as the Avengers isn’t it?

Thor: I never told you that you were in the Revengers, Loki. Not officially. You actually attempted to betray us, remember?

Loki: Well, yes, but then I came to your aid. I earned my place on that team.

Bruce: That’s a fair point. I think Loki should probably be counted as one of the Revengers.

Steve: Well, that’s great, but this is an Avengers meeting, not a Revengers meeting.

Natasha: Exactly.

Tony: Agreed. Get out, Loki.

Loki: Fine. Come on Thor, come on Bruce. We don’t need them.

Bruce: Um….

Thor: Well….

Loki: Really? Really? You’re picking them? Well I can tell you that my feelings are well and truly hurt. HURT, Thor.

Thor: Look, brother, it’s just…

Loki: No, no, you’ve made your loyalties perfectly clear. *Moves slowly towards the door* But I think you are all making a big mistake. I….

Valkyrie: *Busting in* Thor! I’ve been looking everywhere for you. Sorry, am I interrupting something?

Thor: Valkyrie! How wonderful. You are not interrupting at all, these are the Avengers.

Steve: We have heard so much about you Valkyrie. It is an honour to finally meet you. 

Thor: Actually guys, I was thinking that Valkyrie would be a great addition to the team.

Loki: WHAT?

Bruce: Oh yeah, Valkyrie is a badass. We could really use her. And she was a Revenger, after all, so she already has super-team experience.

Natasha: If Bruce says she is worthy, she is.

Tony: Well that’s good enough for me. Welcome aboard, Valkyrie.

Loki: *Standing in the doorway* Un-fucking-believable.
